chunks.en: Why visit relatives, what is the meaning of visiting relatives?
My personal understanding of visiting relatives is that it's a bond between the older generation.
Visiting relatives is to maintain my relationship with my parents' generation and their peers.
But in this process, I found that it goes against what I thought.
Comparing became their motivation for visiting relatives. I was dragged to visit relatives since I was little.
It's a 6-hour round trip.

Every time, we hurriedly eat lunch and leave. I've been going for over ten years, and I haven't even remembered everyone's names, because I knew I couldn't remember them, so I simply didn't bother trying.
This year, my parents asked me to visit relatives again, but I don't even know them, and I don't want to go.
@bclerdx No argument, just a discussion. The meaning of social interaction is the utilization and being utilized between people of value.
For the older generation's agricultural society, where cooperation was needed, only by maintaining good neighborly relations and village relationships could you get help harvesting your wheat.
But now, social interaction is not necessarily the case.
The value of transactions is transparent; everyone is more willing to directly quote prices.
Now, people hire a harvester from the village and directly quote prices based on the size of the land.
There are far fewer times when people ask relatives for help.
If the OP is an office worker, the social interaction that would be useful to him would be to send more red envelopes to headhunters in the IT circle on WeChat and wish them a Happy New Year.
You don't have as much objection to your boss asking you to work overtime every day.
Is it more of a grievance to spend half a day visiting relatives with your family than that?
My finger slipped while typing on my phone.
Visiting your parents' relatives doesn't have direct meaning for you; the meaning is for your parents, who want to see their own relatives.

chunks.en: The meaning for you is that if your parents don't take you, they will be unhappy. You're going to make your parents happy, not to find meaning for yourself.
Visiting relatives is to maintain my relationship with my parents' generation and their peers. âŒ Visiting relatives is to maintain parents' relationship with their peers. âœ…
Why not just not go? Are your parents going to tie you up and take you?
The essence of visiting relatives is the older generation's desire for reunion and the conflict arising from the younger generation's inability to stay long due to work, residence, and other reasons.

In earlier times, when parents, grandparents, and grandchildren all lived in one place, visiting relatives became staying up late on New Year's Eve and paying respects on the first day of the Lunar New Year. Since everyone had the same living habits and lived together, there would naturally be no problem of not being able to remember everyone.

With the acceleration of urbanization, visiting relatives will become more common. With the popularity of high-speed rail stations and airports, visiting relatives is gradually becoming less painful, but growing pains are inevitable.
As rural areas are gradually beautified due to transfer payments from cities, rural areas are also relatively more livable.
But if you really don't get used to living there, you can spend the day in the countryside and stay in a hotel in the county town at night.
Staying longer this way is more meaningful.

Your parents' ability to make the behavior of "traveling 6 hours round trip just to eat a meal and leave" shows that they themselves don't really want to go back, but are forced to go back due to public opinion pressure, and also due to their own homesickness. For wanderers away from home, New Year's Eve is the hardest night to endure, and visiting relatives is the "best antidote" (6 hours round trip for a year of peace of mind, it's worth it). They bring you along simply because they want to express that their family is harmonious and that their family misses the older generation very much, nothing more. It is recommended that you understand since how many more times will you have to visit relatives in the future? Once you get married, you may not have to go with your parents anymore.

Another point, a 6-hour round trip means 3 hours each way, which is about 300 kilometers? It's not too far, about the distance from Beijing to Hengshui. My colleague from Henan takes the high-speed rail home from Beijing, which is at least 6 hours each way.
If you don't want to go, then don't. Is someone tying you up? You're contemplating life over such a small matter. If you're so idle, go consider why people live!
That's so profound!

When someone from your parents' generation passes away, or there are major events in the family, or you want to borrow money, you will know the meaning of visiting relatives. If you complain about not having relatives then, you can't blame others.
Read more books and spend less time online.
It seems that the opinion of many people is that a major purpose of visiting relatives is for weddings and funerals.
But isn't that absurd and ridiculous?

You can still have weddings and funerals without relatives; the only difference is that if many relatives show their support and help out, then from the relatives' point of view, the wedding or funeral will be evaluated as well-managed.
Do you see the logical loop? Visiting relatives is to obtain the high praise of relatives for weddings and funerals.
Since I don't visit relatives, I'll keep weddings and funerals simple, and I don't need the evaluation of relatives, so is this major purpose of visiting relatives really valid?
---------------Furthermore, people say it's for getting through difficulties, or various conveniences and connections, in other words, "social network."
If a person is originally keen on socializing and keen on cultivating a social network, then he would not say that he doesn't want to see relatives unless there is a special situation.

A person who doesn't want to visit relatives either has a feud with relatives, or simply doesn't like to cultivate a social network. If they get along, they'll hang out together; if they don't, they won't flatter and feign compliance for the sake of a social network.

Therefore, people who say visiting relatives is very useful and people who say visiting relatives doesn't mean much are fundamentally two different types of people. There are big differences in personality and how they handle things. It's a difference in underlying thinking, and the view of "visiting relatives" is just a superficial one.

If you only talk about the appearance and don't talk about the underlying thinking, the two sides will naturally have the feeling of talking at cross purposes and not being able to communicate at all, like playing the lute to a cow.
The OP probably doesn't understand social interaction.
